definitions.definition: The person lawfully in command of a ship or other vessel.
definitions.example: The captain is the last man to leave a sinking ship.

definitions.definition: An army officer with a rank between the most senior grade of lieutenant and major.
A naval officer with a rank between commander and commodore.

A commissioned officer in the United States Navy, Coast Guard, NOAA Corps, or PHS Corps of a grade superior to a commander and junior to a rear admiral (lower half). A captain is equal in grade or rank to an Army, Marine Corps, or Air Force colonel.
One of the athletes on a sports team who is designated to make decisions, and is allowed to speak for his team with a referee or official.
The leader of a group of workers.
definitions.example: John Henry said to the captain, "A man ain't nothing but a man."

definitions.definition: The head boy of a school.
An honorific title given to a prominent person. See colonel.
To exercise command of a ship, aircraft or sports team.
